title: Official: Ernest Sowah signs 3-year deal with Kotoko
text:
Sports News | 15 October 2015 18:10 CET Official: Ernest Sowah signs 3-year deal with Kotoko - www.allsports.com.gh 
Ernest Sowah has joined Kumasi Asante Kotoko on a free transfer, after he terminated his contract with Don Bosco. 
Ernest Sowah joined, the Congolese side from Berekum Chelsea in 2013, but after two year stint he deems it necessary to return to the Ghana Premier League, where he had some great seasons that earned the Berekum side the champions of Ghana in 2011. 
A host of clubs were chasing for the signature of the 26-year shot stopper, including Accra Hearts of Oak, but Asante Kotoko have beat their archrivals to his signature. 
'We have signed a 3-year contract with Ernest Sowah,' Kwaku Ahenkorah, the Communications Manager of Asante Kotoko told Allsports.com.gh. 
This will increase the number of goalkeepers at the Kumasi based outfit to 5, namely Isaac Amoako, Joseph Addo, Eric Ofori Antwi and Felix Annan, who has returned from his loan spell with WAFA. 
However, there are reports that Annan might go back to WAFA to reduce the number of goalkeepers to 4, ahead of the upcoming season.
